sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]Â ''novels, Biter is a mindless, mute thug from King's Landing, an associate of Rorge. According to semi-canon source, Rorge ran several fighting pits where dogs and bears would fight one another and also people. Biter fought in these pits and developed a reputation for savage cruelty. He has no tongue and only speaks through hisses. His teeth have been filed to points.

Rorge and Biter helped [[Arya Stark]] and [[Jaqen H'ghar]] to free the Northern prisoners at [[Harrenhal]]. Afterwards they join the Brave Companions, the notorious sellsword company led by [[Locke|Vargo Hoat]].

Biter is known for his bestial savagery. He tears flesh out of his victims' bodies with his sharpened teeth. According to Rorge, Biter once chewed the breasts of a septa sometime during their pillaging.

While Vargo Hoat becomes delirious due to his festering head injury, many of the Brave Companions leave Harrenhal, among them Rorge and Biter. They and five more form a gang that sacks [[Saltpans]]. They never encounter Arya and the Hound.

Rorge and Biter have nothing to do with the [[dying man]] that Arya and the Hound find. He was injured by a [[Bolton]] soldier.

Rorge's gang encountersÂ [[Brienne]] near the [[Inn at the Crossroads]]. Brienne fights Rorge and kills him, butÂ Biter tackles her down, overcomes her and savagely chews her face. Eventually [[Gendry]] intervenes and kills Biter by driving a spear through the back of his neck, but not before Brienne's face is horribly disfigured.
sections.Behind the scenes:
[[File:520px-Biter.png|thumb|The character speculated to be Biter in "Fire and Blood", next to the alleged Rorge]]
Fans have speculated that the three prisoners in Yoren's wagon in the [[Fire and Blood|final episode]] of the [[Season 1|first season]] of the series were meant to be Rorge, Biter and (in a cloak with his face hidden) Jaqen H'ghar. However, these three roles were played by extras, with full-time actors for the roles not hired until filming of Season 2 was underway.
